name: DST Spring-Forward Gap
question: A recurring event happens every Sunday at 2:00 AM Eastern Time, starting March 1, 2026. On March 8, 2026, clocks spring forward at 2:00 AM (skipping directly to 3:00 AM EDT). List the UTC start times of all 5 occurrences.
why_llms_fail: 2:00 AM local doesn't exist on March 8 due to spring-forward. The engine resolves the gap at 07:00 UTC for Mar 8 (same as pre-DST), then shifts to 06:00 UTC (2 AM EDT) for Mar 15 onward. LLMs typically either ignore DST (all 07:00 UTC), shift too early (06:00 UTC from Mar 8), or don't know that the UTC offset changes at all.

name: DST Fall-Back Ambiguity
question: A daily event at 1:30 AM Eastern Time starts on October 29, 2026. On November 1, 2026, clocks fall back at 2:00 AM (so 1:30 AM occurs twice — once in EDT and once in EST). List the UTC start times of all 5 occurrences.
why_llms_fail: On November 1, 1:30 AM local is ambiguous — it occurs in both EDT (UTC-4 = 05:30 UTC) and EST (UTC-5 = 06:30 UTC). The engine picks the first (EDT) occurrence, keeping 05:30 UTC. Only Nov 2 shifts to 06:30 UTC (EST). LLMs either ignore the ambiguity, shift a day early, or apply the wrong offset on the transition day.

name: Last Weekday of Month
question: Find the last weekday (Monday through Friday) of each month for 6 consecutive months starting January 2026. The event occurs at 5:00 PM UTC. List the UTC start times of all 6 occurrences.
why_llms_fail: BYSETPOS=-1 with BYDAY=MO,TU,WE,TH,FR means 'the last weekday of the month,' not 'the last Friday.' LLMs must know the exact number of days in each month AND what day of the week the last day falls on. They frequently confuse this with 'last Friday' or miscalculate which weekday falls on the last business day.

name: EXDATE Exclusions
question: A weekly Tuesday meeting at 10:00 AM UTC starts March 3, 2026 and recurs through April 7, 2026. However, the meetings on March 10, March 17, and March 31 are cancelled (EXDATE). List the UTC start times of the remaining occurrences.
why_llms_fail: LLMs must enumerate all 6 Tuesdays in the date range (Mar 3, 10, 17, 24, 31, Apr 7), then subtract the 3 excluded dates. Many miscount the Tuesdays in range, forget a week, or apply the exclusions incorrectly.

name: Tri-Weekly COUNT
question: A meeting occurs every 3 weeks starting Monday, January 5, 2026 at 10:00 AM Central Time. List the UTC start times of the first 5 occurrences.
why_llms_fail: INTERVAL=3 means every 3rd week (21-day gaps), not every 3rd day. LLMs often miscalculate specific dates when crossing month boundaries. The first 3 occurrences (Jan 5, Jan 26, Feb 16) are CST (UTC-6 = 16:00 UTC), but Mar 9 and Mar 30 are CDT (UTC-5 = 15:00 UTC) — the UTC offset changes mid-sequence.

name: Cross-Year Boundary
question: A weekly Sunday event at 9:00 AM London time starts December 28, 2025. List the UTC start times of the first 6 occurrences.
why_llms_fail: Crossing the year boundary (2025 → 2026) is conceptually simple, but LLMs sometimes skip or duplicate dates around January 1. Europe/London is GMT (UTC+0) in winter, simplifying the timezone math, but some LLMs incorrectly apply BST (British Summer Time, UTC+1).

name: First Monday of Quarter
question: A quarterly board meeting occurs on the first Monday of January, April, July, and October 2026 at 9:00 AM Eastern Time. List the UTC start times of all 4 occurrences.
why_llms_fail: BYDAY=1MO with FREQ=YEARLY and BYMONTH means 'first Monday of each specified month.' LLMs must look up the 2026 calendar to find the actual first Monday of Jan, Apr, Jul, and Oct — AND correctly handle EST (UTC-5) for Jan/Oct vs EDT (UTC-4) for Apr/Jul.

name: UNTIL Timezone Boundary
question: A daily event at 10:00 PM Pacific Standard Time (UTC-8) starts January 10, 2026. The RRULE specifies UNTIL=20260115T045959Z (January 15, 2026 at 04:59:59 UTC). How many occurrences are there, and what are their UTC start times?
why_llms_fail: 10 PM PST = 6 AM next day UTC. So the Jan 10 local occurrence = Jan 11 06:00 UTC. The UNTIL (Jan 15 04:59:59 UTC) excludes the Jan 14 local occurrence (= Jan 15 06:00 UTC, which exceeds UNTIL). Result: 4 occurrences (Jan 10-13 local). LLMs that count calendar dates in local time get 5, and the UTC date shift adds further confusion.

name: Every Weekday (15 days)
question: Starting Monday, March 2, 2026, list the next 15 weekdays (Monday through Friday only) at 9:00 AM Eastern Time. Provide the UTC start times.
why_llms_fail: Seems straightforward — 15 weekdays is 3 full work weeks. But March 8 is DST spring-forward day (clocks move from EST to EDT). Before Mar 8, 9 AM EST = 2 PM UTC. After Mar 8, 9 AM EDT = 1 PM UTC. LLMs that ignore the mid-sequence UTC shift will get 10 of 15 answers wrong.

name: Monthly on the 29th
question: A monthly event occurs on the 29th of each month at 12:00 PM UTC, starting January 29, 2025. List the UTC start times of the first 8 occurrences. Note: 2025 is NOT a leap year (February has only 28 days).
why_llms_fail: February 2025 has no 29th day (not a leap year), so that month is skipped entirely. LLMs either include a nonexistent February 29 date, forget to skip it, or miscount the 8 occurrences after the skip — producing 7 correct dates or inserting Feb 28 as a substitute.
